title: enhancement : recursive uninstallation of dependent packages
body:
##### Modifications :
- [x] added `--dependents` option to uninstall
- [x] always prompt user for confirmation
- [x] add tests for regression on the command
- [x] updated documentation
##### Notes :

This is meant to address #651 . Any comment or bug report on the PR is welcome.
##### Example :

```
$ spack find
==> 8 installed packages.
-- linux-x86_64 / gcc@4.8 ---------------------------------------
bzip2@1.0.6  ncurses@6.0  openssl@1.0.2g  python@2.7.11  python@3.5.1  readline@6.3  sqlite@3.8.5  zlib@1.2.8

$ spack uninstall python
==> Error: python matches multiple packages:

-- linux-x86_64 / gcc@4.8 ---------------------------------------
nk2wnn4 python@2.7.11  7hxo5t5 python@3.5.1

==> Error: You can either:
    a) Use a more specific spec, or
    b) use spack uninstall -a to uninstall ALL matching specs.

$ spack uninstall -a python zlib
==> Error: Will not uninstall zlib@1.2.8%gcc@4.8-pdtswcf

The following packages depend on it:
-- linux-x86_64 / gcc@4.8 ---------------------------------------
3trgywi openssl@1.0.2g

==> Error: You can use spack uninstall -f to force this action

$ spack uninstall -a -d python zlib
==> The following packages will be uninstalled : 

-- linux-x86_64 / gcc@4.8 ---------------------------------------
3trgywi openssl@1.0.2g  nk2wnn4 python@2.7.11  7hxo5t5 python@3.5.1  pdtswcf zlib@1.2.8

==> Do you want to proceed ? [y/n]
y
==> Successfully uninstalled python@2.7.11%gcc@4.8=linux-x86_64-nk2wnn4
==> Successfully uninstalled python@3.5.1%gcc@4.8=linux-x86_64-7hxo5t5
==> Successfully uninstalled openssl@1.0.2g%gcc@4.8=linux-x86_64-3trgywi
==> Successfully uninstalled zlib@1.2.8%gcc@4.8=linux-x86_64-pdtswcf
```
